ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: Lunarpine could see her pain, Shadow Wing wasn t programmed as a warrior. He saw that now, he fealt for her but knew that a wolf and an owl weren t meant to

Received: (qmail 1736 invoked from network); 5 Jul 2000 22:44:55 -0000
Received: from unknown (10.1.10.142) by m4.onelist.org with QMQP; 5 Jul 2000 22:44:55 -0000
Received: from unknown (HELO hj.egroups.com) (10.1.10.42) by mta1 with SMTP; 5 Jul 2000 22:44:55 -0000
X-eGroups-Return: cyberwolf4@...
Received: from [10.1.10.110] by hj.egroups.com with NNFMP; 05 Jul 2000 22:44:54 -0000
Date: Wed, 05 Jul 2000 22:44:38 -0000
To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
Message-ID: <8k0dom+cbnf@...>
In-Reply-To: <20000705222945.14573.qmail@...>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 2839
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: cyberwolf4@...

Lunarpine could see her pain, Shadow Wing wasn't programmed as a 
warrior. He saw that now, he fealt for her but knew that a wolf and 
an owl weren't meant to work together, were they? He turned back to 
the crow and gobbled it up. In his world scavenging food was just as 
important as hunting it. Shadow Wing was a good hunter as an owl but 
she didn't seam to realize that she was more. she has the ability to 
change into something that gives her an edge yo the hunt. If she 
could learn that, she might survive. In the cold he'd want her at his 
side, but he still wasn't sure how she'd fight in this climate. Her 
emotions were her weakness. One moment she wanted the hunt, the kill, 
the next moment she wanted to run away and hide. 
"I'm sorry." he said more to himself than to her. "I'm sorry I had to 
do that to help you survive."
Lunarpine wiped his mouth and headed back to base, alone again.
--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "Logo morph" <logomorph@h...> wrote:
> ::Shadow Wing::
> 
> She froze for a second when he yelled BANG.  She fell to the ground 
as he 
> let her go.  She couldn't say anything.  She looked at him for a 
moment.  
> She she flew off.  She didn't say a word.  She just flew off into 
the sky.  
> She was hurt inside.  The game went to far.  She flew even higher 
into the 
> sky.  She knew that he would never want her for a partner now.  She 
started 
> to sob as she flew into the clouds.  It hurt her down to her 
spark.  She 
> didn't want to back to the base.  She didn't even want to look at 
him.  He 
> scared her.  She also let herself fall for him.  She let her spark 
fall for 
> him.  But that was one mistake that she would not go and do again. 
Never 
> again, she thought. She flew through the cloud bank, hoping to lose 
herself 
> in the cool air of the upper sky.
> 
> -----original message-----
> >From: cyberwolf4@p...
> 
> >
> >The wolfbot knew not to push his "Wild" side to far. Owls and 
wolves
> >competed in the frozen wilderness he came from, but not here. Pain
> >scorched through his right arm (The one holding her). He knew not 
to
> >release her or she'd claw hhis eyes out. In beast mode her talons
> >were her most powerful weapon. Lunarpine lowered his claw anr 
pulled
> >his rifle. holding it up he pointed to the owls chest. Her head
> >wasn't as big a part of her robot mode, destroy it and she'd be
> >repairable. he was aiming for the one part that held her spark in
> >both modes. "BANG" Lunarpine shouted, "Game over" He dropped her to
> >the ground and jumped back ready to react if necessary. "When I 
play
> >Wing it's for keeps. So will the Predicons. Remember this lesson 
and
> >it won't be your last.
> 
>
